com.google.api.client.http.json Documentation Differences

This file contains all the changes in documentation in the package com.google.api.client.http.json as colored differences. Deletions are shown like this, and additions are shown like this.
If no deletions or additions are shown in an entry, the HTML tags will be what has changed. The new HTML tags are shown in the differences. If no documentation existed, and then some was added in a later version, this change is noted in the appropriate class pages of differences, but the change is not shown on this page. Only changes in existing text are shown here. Similarly, documentation which was inherited from another class or interface is not shown here.
Note that an HTML error in the new documentation may cause the display of other documentation changes to be presented incorrectly. For instance, failure to close a <code> tag will cause all subsequent paragraphs to be displayed differently.
Class JsonHttpContent

Serializes JSON HTTP content based on the data key/value mapping object for an item.

Sample usage: 

 
  static void setContent(HttpRequest request, Object data) {
    JsonHttpContent content = request.setContent(new JsonHttpContent();
    content.jsonFactory = new JacksonFactory();
    content.data =, data));
   }
 request.content
 =
content;

Implementation } is not thread-safe.

@since 1.0 @author Yaniv Inbar
Class JsonHttpContent, String contentType

Content type. Default value is Json.CONTENT_TYPE. @deprecated (scheduled to be made private in 1.6) Use .getType or .setType
Class JsonHttpContent, Object data

KeyJSON key name/value pair data. @deprecated (scheduled to be made private final in 1.6) Use .getData
Class JsonHttpContent, JsonFactory jsonFactory

(Required) JSON factory to use. @since 1.33 @deprecated (scheduled to be made private final in 1.6) Use .getJsonFactory
Class JsonHttpParser

Parses HTTP JSON response content into an data class of key/value pairs.

Implementation is thread-safe as long as the fields are not set directly (which is deprecated usage).

Sample usage: 

 
  static void setParser(HttpTransport transportHttpRequest request) {
    JsonHttpParser parser = request.addParser(new JsonHttpParser();
    parser.jsonFactory = new JacksonFactory();
    transport.addParser(parser));
  }
@since 1.0 @author Yaniv Inbar
Class JsonHttpParser, JsonParser parserForResponse(JsonFactory, HttpResponse)

Returns a JSON parser to use for parsing the given HTTP response.

The response content will be closed if any throwable is thrown. On success, the current token will be the first top token, which is normally JsonToken.START_ARRAY or JsonToken.START_OBJECT.

@param jsonFactory JSON factory to use @param response HTTP response @return JSON parser @throws IllegalArgumentException if content type is not Json.CONTENT_TYPE @throws IOException I/O exception @since 1.3
Class JsonHttpParser, String contentType

Content type. Default value is Json.CONTENT_TYPE. @deprecated (scheduled to be made private final in 1.6) Use .getContentType or Builder.setContentType
Class JsonHttpParser, JsonFactory jsonFactory

(Required) JSON factory to use. @since 1.33 @deprecated (scheduled to be made private final in 1.6) Use .getJsonFactory
